short-change.translation[0].definitions[: to treat someone unfairly by not giving them what they deserve or hoped for
When the band only played for 15 minutes, the fans felt they had been short-changed.
to give back too little money to a customer who has bought something and paid more than the exact amount for it
short-change.translation[1].definitions[: to treat someone unfairly by cheating them or not giving them what they deserve
The consumer is tired of being short-changed by cartels.
to give someone too little CHANGE (=money given back to someone when they have paid more than the exact price)
I later discovered that the store had short-changed me by $10.
